summary: Irving J. Leff is mentioned in connection with John Rosselli's activities in Los Angeles during October and November 1962. He is associated with Rosselli at the Friars Club and in other meetings. The documents suggest Leff was part of Rosselli's social circle. There is no direct indication of Leff's involvement in the JFK assassination context from these documents.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Irving J. Leff's significance in the JFK assassination context is not apparent. He appears to be an associate of John Rosselli during the period covered by these documents.
